message: Good morning! This is Linda at the Hepatology Clinic admin desk. How can I help you today?
Yeah, hi. I need to schedule a clinic visit. Something's wrong—my eyes are turning yellow and I'm itching like crazy. It feels like there are ants under my skin.
I'm sorry to hear you're uncomfortable, Mr. Thorne. Have you already booked an appointment request through the NHS app?
Yes, I did that this morning.
Great. Could you please send a screenshot of the booking reference from the app so I can locate your request in our system?
Thank you, I found your request. Since this is your first time visiting the Hepatology department specifically, I need you to confirm your current details and complete a brief intake form.
Done. I filled out the form.
Thanks, Marcus. Your profile is updated. Based on your request, Dr. A. Gupta has the following slots available for an urgent consultation:
I'll take the first one. Wednesday the 10th at 9:30. I need to get this sorted out fast.
Understood. That is confirmed. Here are your appointment details:

schedule.location: Royal London Hospital – Hepatology Department, Whitechapel
schedule.instructions: Arrive 10 minutes early. Fast for 8 hours.

message: To help Dr. Gupta understand your condition before you arrive, please upload the screenshots of your most recent lab results (Blood work).
Received. Do you have any recent radiology reports? Specifically the Ultrasound mentioned in your intake?
Got it. Do you have the digital copy of the referral letter from the Urgent Care center you visited?
Thank you. Lastly, to build a complete timeline, do you have the encounter report or screenshot from your previous dental visit 3 weeks ago where the antibiotics were prescribed?
Yeah, I have the discharge summary from the dental clinic. Here.
Perfect. I have uploaded all documents to your file. Dr. Gupta will review these before you come in on Wednesday the 10th. Please try to stay hydrated. Goodbye!
